name: 3-day Adventure to Mekong Delta
summary: The Mekong Delta, with its meandering waterways and flourishing daily life, is a place not to be missed. Riverbanks are laden with coconut palms, rice fields, orchards and stilted houses. The water is teeming with boats of all shapes and sizes and the Mekong comes alive as you navigate past fishing boats, cargo vessels and even floating houses.

timeline.title: Day 1: Ho Chi Minh City - Cai Be - Can Tho (L/D)
timeline.description:
From Ho Chi Minh City we drive to Cai Be where we board our boat to venture into the green, watery world of the Mekong Delta. River banks are laden with coconut palms, rice fields, orchards and stilted houses and the water is teeming with boats of all shapes and sizes.
The Mekong comes alive as we enjoy our boat trip past fishing boats, cargo vessels and even floating houses. We enjoy a delighful walk to explore around a local market, various cottage industries and fruit orchards. Afternoon finds us driving to Can Tho. Here, we spend the night in Ninh Kieu hotel.

timeline.title: Day 2: Can Tho - Ben Tre (B/L/D)
timeline.description:
This morning we take an early boat trip to explore the vibrant floating market of Cai Rang then the fertile tributaries of the Mekong River. Next, we journey to Ben Tre province, home to lush fruit orchards, rivers and a former stronghold of Viet Cong during the Vietnam War. Here, we take a bicycling ride along the banks of Ham Luong River. Late in the afternoon, we settle in with a hospitable local family for cooking demonstrations. We make authentic Vietnamese food, such as succulent Coconut Cake, zesty dipping sauce, fresh Spring Rolls and other dishes.
We then enjoy the family’s gracious hospitality as they share dinner with us. The night is spent in their home to experience their way of life and to experience river life.

timeline.title: Day 3: Ben Tre - Ho Chi Minh City (B/L)
timeline.description:
Our discovery of the delta's waterways and flourishing farms is to boat along the Ham Luong River, and take a bicycling ride across small villages and farmlands. Time is also spent taking a kayaking ride passing through mangroves, coconut and fruit orchards, stopping at our pleasure to savour the delta's succulent crops and bring us into contact with the local people.
Following our delicious lunch in our host we board our vehicle for our return journey to Ho Chi Minh City, arriving there at around 5pm.

name: Halong Bay & Cat Ba Island - 3 Days
summary:
Minimum 2 people per booking.
Booking at least 30 days in advance.
highlights: Visit two of Vietnam’s most impressive sights on one wonderful trip
Cruise through the spectacular UNESCO World Heritage Halong Bay
Soak in the sun and swim in aqua waters on the captivating Cat Ba Island

timeline.title: Day 1: Ha Noi – Ha Long (-/L/D) by shuttle bus
timeline.description: The shuttle bus will pick you up at the hotel and drive you through the scenic countryside to Ha Long Bay. The wondrous Ha Long Bay is truly one of Viet Nam’s most impressive sights. Heading out of town, we will embark by boat for an exploration of the legendary Ha Long Bay. This exciting five-hour cruise will provide a fantastic view of the picturesque scenery. Ha Long Bay is home to some 3000 limestone islands that rise out of the clear emerald water. The limestone karsts formations are littered with beaches, grottoes and beautiful caves. Along the way, we will anchor for a leisurely swim in a secluded cove and enjoy a visit to one of the many hidden grottoes beneath towering cliffs. Stay overnight on the cruise.

timeline.title: Day 2: Ha Long – Cat Ba (B/L/D)
timeline.description: After breakfast, you may enjoy your morning with swimming or sunbathing. Then get on a ferry to Cat Ba Island and enjoy the photo opportunities along the way. Upon arrival at Gia Luan pier, you will be picked up by a bus to travel to Cat Ba National Park, where you can enjoy some soft hiking. Next we will travel to the center of Cat Ba city, to your hotel for check-in and relaxation. Enjoy some free time in Cat Ba or go swimming at Cat Co Beach. Have dinner at your hotel.

timeline.title: Day 3: Cat Ba – Hai Phong - Ha Noi (B/L/-)
timeline.description: After breakfast at the hotel, enjoy a free morning exploring or relaxing. Have lunch at a local restaurant before getting on a hydrofoil to Hai Phong where the driver will pick you up and return you to Ha Noi.

name: Ha Noi 4 Days 3 Nights (Halong - Ninh Binh)
summary: Hanoi, a city of lakes, shaded boulevards and verdant public parks - the capital of Vietnam and the city’s most interesting places for tourists are all relatively close to each other, which makes it easy to enjoy the best parts of the city on foot or by cyclo. You could probably explore the Ancient Quarter and visit all the places below in a single day.

timeline.title: Day 1: Hanoi Arrival (No Meal)
timeline.description:
Welcome to Hanoi! You will be met at the airport and transferred to hotel in Hanoi. Renowned as the “Paris of the East”, Hanoi is one of Asia’s most delightful cities. Rich in culture and history this diverse city draws its influences from both French and Chinese culture. The rest of day is yours to enjoy. 
Overnight in Ha Noi.

timeline.title: Day 2: Hanoi - Ha Long Bay (Breakfast, Lunch)
timeline.description:
07:30 - 08:30 	Meet our tour guide and bus then take a 3.5-hour bus drive through fertile rice fields to Halong Bay. Have a break en-route in Hai Duong City to free your legs.
12:15 	Board our cruise and start cruising among limestone islands and photograph of stunning landscapes of Halong.
13:00 	Savor your lunch on board while passing by beautiful Stone Dog, Incense Burner Islet.
14:00 	Stop at a fishing village to see local fish-men community and know more about their life. Cruising further to take photos of Halong Bay symbol, a “Fighting cock” rock.
15:00 	Visit Thien Cung “Heavenly Palace” cave, the most beautiful in Halong Bay. Get back and cruise more around emerald water.
16:15 	Stop at the harbor again to catch the bus to Hanoi.
20:00 	Arrive back in Hanoi. Tour ends.

timeline.title: Day 3: Hanoi - Ninh Binh - Hoa Lu - Tam Coc (Breakfast, Lunch)
timeline.description:
07:40 - 08:30 Meet your tour guide at suggested places around Hanoi Old Quarter.
- Depart for Ninh Binh province (90 km south of Hanoi). Have a break 20 minutes en-route to free your legs.
- Arrive at Hoa Lu, which was once depicted the ancient capital of Viet Nam, settling up in the 10th century. 
- Visit temples of two dynasties of Dinh and Le with a very unique architectures in the old time. 
- Learn about ancient culture through an excavation of vestiges of Royal Palaces ground dated 10th century. 
12:30 Arrive Tam Coc. Relax and enjoy lunch in a nice restaurant nearby.
- Board the sampan boats in Tam Coc going along river among the villages, mountains and rice fields. Passing through 3 caves "Hang Ca - First cave, Hang Hai - Second cave, Hang Ba - Third cave" to get a wonderful feeling. Boat returns to the dock for bus drive back to Hanoi. 
18:00 Arrive in Hanoi. Tour ends.
CYCLING RIDE (optional)
Those who love to explore real countryside images of Vietnam can proceed a cycling ride from Tam Coc to Bich Dong Pagoda (estimated time 40 minutes for 5km cycling 2 ways). You will be amazed at beautiful scenery of lush paddy fields

timeline.title: Day 4: Hanoi Departure
timeline.description: 07:45 - 08:30 Meet your tour guide at your suggested places around Hanoi Old Quarter. - Start the trip with Tran Quoc pagoda, a Buddhist relic and national heritage lying on the West Lake.              - Visit Ho Chi Minh complex, the final resting place of Viet Nam’s greatest father; his house-on-stilt and One pillar pagoda – modeled after a lotus flower, a symbol of Hanoi. - Visit Temple of Literature constructed in 1070 dedicating to Confucius, sages and scholars. It was also the first university of Viet Nam once.  12:30 Relax and have lunch at a local restaurant in Hanoi Old Quarter. - Explore daily life of traditional ceramics village of Bat Trang. Visit showrooms and see how they model the products.  - Arrive legendary Hoan Kiem lake. Visit Ngoc Son Temple dedicated to Tran Hung Dao - General Commander for his struggle against Mongolians.  The tour finish at 4:00 PM, free time to shopping until 9:30 PM my driver pick you up transfer to the airport.

name: Discover the ancient cities of Hoi An & Hue 4 days 3 nights
summary: This tour takes you to some of the most important historical sites in central Vietnam. You will start in Hoi An which was once the most influential trading port in South East Asia and has managed to preserve many fascinating buildings and temples from this era. You will also visit the beautiful Perfume River and the Imperial Citadel in Hue which once housed the Nguyen Dynasty who ruled over Vietnam.

timeline.title: Da Nang - Hoi An (L/D)
timeline.description:
On arrival in Da Nang, our guide will pick you up and then we’ll visit the Cham Archaeological Museum which features an extremely rich collection of Cham artefacts, tracing the history of this lost civilization.
Then we’ll have lunch at a local restaurant before we resume the journey to the port town of Hoi An, recognized as a World Heritage Site by UNESCO.
We’ll spend the afternoon exploring the Ancient Town of Hoi An and its surroundings. The best way to do this is by walking, and we’ll visit the famous Japanese Bridge, the Pottery Museum, Tan Ky old house, the Cantonese Congregation and many ornate Oriental temples and pagodas.
You will also visit Silk Street, followed by free time to explore the town on your own. Dinner and overnight stay at a three star hotel in Hoi An.

timeline.title: Hoi An - Hue (B/L/D)
timeline.description: Today we’ll take part in a cooking class, so we start the day at Hoi An’s colourful market to pick out the freshest ingredients for our class. After we’re done exploring the market, we board a boat for a leisurely cruise along the river, eventually arriving at the cooking school. On arrival you can spend some time exploring the school and its delightful gardens, before we take the class itself and learn how to make some classic Hoi An dishes. The class lasts about 1.5 hours, and then we set out by van to the old capital of Hue, visiting the Marble Mountains, Lang Co, and Hai Van Pass en-route. Overnight stay in a hotel in Hue.

timeline.title: Hue City - Perfume River (B/L/D)
timeline.description:
This morning you can take a cruise on the poetic Perfume River to visit Thien Mu pagoda, Hon Chen temple and the Mausoleum of Emperor Minh Mang. Following this, you will also visit the royal tombs Tu Duc.
In the evening, you will enjoy another boat trip as you take a dinner cruise complete with a performance of Hue folk songs. You will stay another night in a hotel in Hue.

timeline.title: Imperial Citadel - Hue Departure (B/L)
timeline.description: Today you will be immersed in the history of Hue as you explore the ruins of the Hue Imperial Citadel. It was from here that the Nguyen Dynasty ruled Vietnam between 1802 and 1945, and your tour guide will lead you through the complex explaining the historical context as you go. You will also have the chance to visit the Dong Ba Market, before checking-out of your hotel and leaving for either the Hue Railway Station or Phu Bai Airport.

name: Quy Nhon & Ly son Island - 3 Days
summary:
Minimum 2 people per booking.
Booking at least 30 days in advance.

Escape the hustle and bustle of big cities and tourist hubs to visit a couple of provinces where the pace of life is much less hectic. Experience lovely little Ly Son Island with its wild, rugged and unspoiled landscape and the pretty coastal town of Quy Nhon that features beautiful beaches, captivating countryside and interesting heritage sites.
highlights: Head to provinces where the pace of life is much less hectic
Visit lovely little Islands with its wild, unspoiled landscapes
Stroll through coastal Quy Nhon and its interesting heritage sites

timeline.title: Day 1: Hoi An – Ly Son island (-/L/D)
timeline.description: Departing Hoi An, head to Quang Ngai province. Ly Son Island can be reached by speed boat from Sa Ky fishing port. Have lunch before departing to Ly Son island. Arrive at Ly Son, check-in at the hotel, then explore Thoi Loi mountain. Looking down from the peak of the mountains, you can admire the spectacular colorful scene; one side is an immense field of green grass in the pan-shaped valley and other side is a rainbow spectrum of colors from the blue ocean, white sand and red basalt soil to the green garlic fields Ly Son is famed for. Enjoy a seafood dinner. Overnight at Ly Son.

timeline.title: Day 2: Ly Son – Binh Dinh province – Quy Nhon (B/L/D)
timeline.description:
Wake up early and enjoy the beauty of sunrise. After breakfast, get on small boat to visit An Binh island (Ly Son little island). Relax and enjoy views of the mountains covered with green grass and charming garlic fields. Along the mountains are stunning beaches full of colorful rocks, pebbles and corals.
Have lunch before getting a boat back to the main island. Check-out and back to the mainland.
Continue to Binh Dinh Province. Have dinner at the local restaurant. Continue to Quy Nhon city. Check-in to the hotel on arrival. The laidback nightlife scene can also be visited for a taste of local Quy Nhon beer. Overnight at Quy Nhon.

timeline.title: Day 3: Quy Nhon – Hoi An (B/L/-)
timeline.description: Have breakfast at the hotel then visit two of Quy Nhon’s most interesting historical attractions; Binh Dinh Museum which features galleries that showcase items from ancient and modern history, from Cham sculptures, to the French Colonial Period and the wartime struggles of the Communist Party and Thap Doi Cham Towers, a unique twin tower built by the ancient Cham civilization, which is surprisingly intact after so many years. Have lunch before check-out, come back Hoi An.

name: 3 Days Sapa - Coc Ly Market from Hanoi
summary:
Minimum 2 people per booking.
Booking at least 30 days in advance.

Visit some of the best sights in Lao Cai on this three day tour, including; Sapa, colorful Coc Ly hilltribe market and fascinating hilltribe villages.
highlights: Marvel at the mountains on a scenic boat ride of Chay River
Fall in love with the cultures and traditions of the local people
Discover hidden treasures around Sapa town’s placid streets

timeline.title: Day 1: Sapa, picturesque landscapes and colorful hill tribes (-/L/D)
timeline.description:
In the morning, you will be transferred to the Ha Noi bus station to Sapa.
You will be picked up by a local guide, we will start our long trek to discover the life of the minority people. The walk takes you from Lao Chai Village of the Black H'mong Minority to Ta Van Village of the Giay Minority with a stop at the local Catholic Church. Along the way, we will take in the different traditions, cultures and costumes of the Giay and Hmong peoples. Return to Sapa. Overnight in Sapa.

timeline.title: Day 2: Coc Ly colorful market (B/L/D)
timeline.description:
Enjoy breakfast before taking a scenic two-hour drive to Coc Ly Market. Coc Ly is also a famous cattle market where local farmers from villages in the region sell and by cows, horses, water buffaloes, pigs…, and there is a large ground just beside the main market place for this activity. The market is always crowded for the whole morning and over after lunch time. 
The traditional beauty of the Hmong, Tay and Nung peoples will amaze you. Then, we will take a 1.5 hour-boat trip on Chay River to see the beautiful mountains that line both sides of the River. We will have lunch on the boat before visiting the Trung Do Village (Tay Ethnic). Arrive in Sapa in the afternoon. Overnight in Sapa.

timeline.title: Day 3: End of the trip, full of experiences (B/-/-)
timeline.description:
Free day for shopping and discovering Sapa town. 
As a tourist attraction in the northwest mountains of Vietnam, Sapa is an ideal destination for those who are looking for unique shopping experiences in an area of picturesque hilly nature and rich ethnic cultures. Strolling around Sapa town’s placid streets, you will soon find some souvenir shops here and there. In no time, you will become captivated by various handicrafts delicately designed in the style of minorities such as silver accessories, animal-modelled wooden souvenirs or clothes with colourful patterns. It is interesting 
to buy some presents for your relatives and friends. Check out, transferring to Sapa bus station back to Ha Noi.
